TEXT: e1: There should be much higher fines for dog dirt left on pavements.
e2: Stepping in dog dirt is gross and absolutely ruins your day
CN RELATION: stepping in dog dirt, gross (HasProperty)/stepping in dog dirt, ruin of day (Causes)

TEXT: e3: due to the dirt, the stench and the often considerable effort to get rid of it.
CN RELATION: dog dirt, stench (HasA)/dog dirt, ruin your day (CapableOf)/stence, ruin your day (CapableOf)/effort to get rid of dog dirt, ruin your day (CapableOf)/dirt, ruin your day (Causes)/stence, ruin your day (Causes)/effort to get rid of dog dirt, ruin your day (Causes)

TEXT: e4: Besides, the fines for public urination by a human are higher than for leaving behind dog dirt on the pavement, which is disproportionate.
CN RELATION: public urination by a human, higher fines (HasA)/public urination by a human, higher fines (Causes)/leaving behind dog dirt, higher fines (NotHasA)/leaving behind dog dirt, higher fines (NotCauses)/higher fines for public urination by a human, disproportionate (HasProperty)

TEXT: e5: Some dog owners assume that paying a dog licence fee covers the removal of such waste,
CN RELATION: dog owners, pay dog licence (CapableOf)/waste, removed (ReceivesAction)/dog licence fee, removal of dog dirt (NotUsedFor)

TEXT: e6: but according to this logic one could hardly make the taxpayer accountable for almost any offense.
